answers.author: Kenneth Decker
answers.text:
For an internship to be meaningful, an intern has to be given meaningful work.  This requires a serious investment of time by a city manager.  Before I would consider creating an internship opportunity, I would need to be comfortable that I am investing enough time and energy into the professional development of our existing team.  Those of us managing small cities are stretched pretty thin, Russell.  While I think many ICMA members value internships, we also have to deal with real world priorities.

answers.text:
Mr. Decker thank you for your answer sir I appreciate your answer and value your opinion. If city managers would utilize this great outlet for Interns we as future city managers would aspire to whom for which we have come from. Thinking that this could only be a hindrance rather than an opportunity for the city to get real world and current academic substance from an Intern can be of great value for you and the city for which you are in charge of getting the most out of your current employees can only aspire to greatness when your own employees see the determination of an Intern.
